messages.content: avatar-graph-comfyui is a custom nodes module for ComfyUI that enables the creation of real-time interactive avatars powered by the Blender bpy mesh API and Avatech Shape Flow runtime.
What is the recommended minimum resolution for character images used with avatar-graph-comfyui?
For optimal results, it is recommended to use character images with a minimum resolution of 768x768 when working with avatar-graph-comfyui.
What is the purpose of the 'Create Mesh Layer' node in avatar-graph-comfyui?
The 'Create Mesh Layer' node in avatar-graph-comfyui is used to create a mesh object from input images, which are usually segmented parts of the entire image.
How does the 'Match Texture Aspect Ratio' node function in avatar-graph-comfyui?

Since meshes are created in a 1:1 aspect ratio in avatar-graph-comfyui, the 'Match Texture Aspect Ratio' node is used to rescale the mesh at the end of the operation to match the desired aspect ratio.
What does the 'Create Shape Flow' node in avatar-graph-comfyui do?
The 'Create Shape Flow' node in avatar-graph-comfyui creates a runtime shape flow graph, allowing interactive inputs to affect shape key values in real-time.
What is the primary output node for the .ava file in avatar-graph-comfyui?
In avatar-graph-comfyui, the primary output node for the .ava file is the 'Avatar Main Output' node. The embedded Avatar View will automatically update with this node's output.
Why is the '--enable-cors-header' flag used when running ComfyUI with avatar-graph-comfyui?

The '--enable-cors-header' flag is used to enable communication between ComfyUI and the Avatech editor (https://editor.avatech.ai), which is responsible for animating static characters. It allows the exchange of character data and JSON graphs between the two applications.
